tool.name: SAGA.ta_morphometry.5
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayELEVATION False output_data_TABLE $output_data_TABLE name SAGA.ta_morphometry.5 ELEVATION $ELEVATION COUNT $COUNT SORTING $SORTING METHOD $METHOD BZRANGE $BZRANGE ZRANGE_MIN $ZRANGE_MIN ZRANGE_MAX $ZRANGE_MAX prefer $prefer response $response outputType_TABLE $OutputSection_TABLE.outputType_TABLE transmissionMode_TABLE $OutputSection_TABLE.transmissionMode_TABLE

param.name: ELEVATION
param.label: Elevation
param.help: Elevation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid, png

param.name: COUNT
param.label: Number of Classes
param.help: Number of discrete intervals (bins) used for sampling

param.name: SORTING
param.label: Sort
param.help: Choose how to sort the elevation dataset before sampling

param.name: METHOD
param.label: Classification Constant
param.help: Choose the classification constant to use

param.name: BZRANGE
param.label: Use Z-Range
param.help: Use a user-specified elevation range instead of min/max of the input dataset

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_TABLE
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_TABLE
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Calculates the hypsometric curve for a given DEM.<br/><br/>The hypsometric curve is an empirical cumulative distribution function of elevations in a catchment or of a whole planet. The tool calculates both the relative (scaled from 0 to 100 percent) and absolute (minimum to maximum values) distributions. The former scales elevation and area by the maximum values. Such a non-dimensional curve allows one to asses the similarity of watersheds as differences in hypsometric curves arise from different geomorphic processes shaping a landscape.<br/><br/>In case the hypsometric curve should not be calculated for the whole elevation range of the input dataset, a user-specified elevation range can be specified with the classification constant area.<br/><br/>The output table has two attribute columns with relative height and area values, and two columns with absolute height and area values. In order to plot the non-dimensional hypsometric curve as diagram, use the relative area as x-axis values and the relative height for the y-axis. For a diagram with absolute values, use the absolute area as x-axis values and the absolute height for the y-axis.
